lines.text: Time for a shortcut.
Timmy, you've got to be ready mentally and physically ha ha.
[Justin swings on vine over a pond]
Wahoo! Ready for what? Whoa!
[Timmy swings on vine and falls in the pond]
To fulfill your destiny.
This was our last race together and I ruined it. I'm sorry Martin.
Nah. I'll be the sorry one if something happens to you hero. Ha ha ha.
Don't call me that Martin. You're the hero type, not me. Nicodemus would've chosen you.
For once you're right, I'm older and stronger than you. If thorn Valley wanted Jonathan Brisby's son, Why'd they pick the runt?
It's true. I mess up everything.
Look I'm sorry Timmy. you'll do great, really. Come on or you'll miss your flight. Hey, wait a minute. I've got something for you. Here a going away present.
[Martin gives Timmy his slingshot]
Golly for real? Teach me.

[Opening lines]
In the beginning, they were just ordinary street rats. Until, they were captured by man and taken to NIMH. The National Institute for Mental Health. They went through experiments. For some strange reason, they become intelligent. They found, they could read. And so they escaped through the ventilation system. None of them would've survived, were it not for that incredible bravery of that great mouse Johnathan Brisby. But alas, he could not save himself. The wisest of creatures, the great owl once said, Johnathan Brisby was the bravest of them all.
Tonight we journey to Thorn Valley, We must leave no evidence that the Rats of NIMH ever existed.

But Johnathan Brisby's widow and her family stay behind in a home they'd always known. The prophet Nicodemus predicted that NIMH will again thrust its evil on the grass and a son of Johnathan Brisby will be chosen to save them.
Martin! Huh? Ahh! What? Ow! Hey! What's going on?
[Then the cage door closed behind Timmy and the alarm goes off]
I think we've caught one Dr. Valentine.
[Then Dr. Valentine and his Assistant runs over with their nets to the cage]
Help! I'm trapped! Martin help!
Timmy? Oh! I told him to stay on the path, he never listens.
[Martin gets off the walnut shell and lets the rabbit go. He then runs over to the cage]
Martin help me.
[Then Martin struggles to lift the latch up]
Lift the door.
[Timmy lifts up the cage door and escapes]
Run!
[They both run off while Dr. Valentine and his Assistant arrive to find an empty cage]
It has to be one of the escaped rats Dr.
[Dr. Valentine picks up the cages and looks at it]
He was smart enough to undo the latch. They must be close.
It's them!
[Then Dr. Valentine and his assistant run to search for them]
Wow what a shot!
[after watching the slingshot hit the acorns on the tree branches]
Just set your sights, concentrate on the target and let er rip. Come on Timmy you can do this, aim a little higher now, and fire!
[Timmy struggles to pull the slingshot but the sling snaps back and hits his head knocking him to the ground]
Ha ha ha, that's using your head hero. I know you're trying. Just remember some try Brisbys do.
[Timmy gets back up and Martin gives the slingshot back to Timmy]
When I grow up, I wanna be just like you Martin.
Yeah well, everybody's got a different mouse in mind.
I can do it just like Whoa!
[Then Auntie Shrew calls out Timmy's name]
Timmy!
[Tim slips and accidentally fires a slingshot and shoots a pebble in the sky]
Tim.
What did I do now?
You know where I can find a volunteer for tonight's collection detail?
Me?

[Timmy and Jenny are in the Courtroom on trial]
Tim you left your post, you put us all in danger.
But I...
You've got to learn to listen, you always think you know better than everyone else.
I know and I'm sorry. But that doesn't change the fact that Jenny can read.
Is that true young lady? Can you really read?
Yes. Look, I've been sent here to find you.
To find us? We don't want to be found. Who would know about us?
My parents to start with.
And who might your parents be?
The McBrides.
What! Well I'll be. Two of the lost six.
That's impossible, they were lost when they escaped from NIMH.

[a flashback comes up showing the lost rats escape from NIMH through the ventilation. The rats landed in the basement and took care of each other. Then the rats were recaptured by Dr. Valentine and his scientist assistants getting caught in a net and being caged up, Dr. Valentine laughs]

No, they were swept away into the ventilation system but they ended up in the basement. They stayed there until the injured got better. Just when they tried again to escape, that's when it happened. They were recaptured by Dr. Valentine.
[the flashback ends and it shows Timmy and Jenny back in the courtroom]
Everything has changed in the labs. Dr Valentine is crazier than ever. My parents and the others sent me to find you, you've just got to help.
I'm afraid you asked too much of us Ms. McBride.
But something terrible is about to happen at NIMH. No one knows what it is. But it has something to do with the next full moon.
The full moon?

[Timmy runs up to Mr. Ages]
Mr. Ages! Did you see it Mr. Ages? That old snake won't be hunting us for breakfast anymore.
Hmm no. I suppose he won't. Well at least I know what happened to the weather balloon I asked you to get for me.
Oh, I'm sorry. I was just trying to help make the valley safe.
The valley is safe enough as long as it remains unknown to the outside world. My boy what have I've been trying to teach you all these months?
Um that it's OK for guys to wear the same underwear three days in a row.
[Mr. Ages puts his hand on Timmy's shoulder]
Well that was just between us. Now what else?
[Mr. Ages and Timmy go on a walk]
I've got to think things all the way through.
And if snakes go flying through the air, humans might find out about Thorn Valley. And then we might be in real danger.
From who?
From NIMH.
What's NIMH?

Let's hope you never find out. Your father saved us from NIMH. We wouldn't be in Thorn Valley if it weren't for him. Jonathan Brisby was a great mouse. And you're his son. You can be every bit remarkable as he was if you think things through. Always see the big picture.
[Shows Timmy a statue of Jonathan Brisby in the fountain]
I'll never be you.
